ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: The opportunity to work with clients was great, and the course was very interactive.

Love it. This is knowledge in practice. I always learn more from 'doing'. This class gives that opportunity. All three professors were excellent and complemented each other well. I highly value what i learned in this class. It is a high expression of what education can be.

The experience is all about the client: the responsiveness of the client, the interst of the client in the project, the client's willingness to work to the student team, and vice versa. If the client is engaged, excited, and available, this is a great, practical course.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Great opportunity and excellent projects.
Kit Kennedy pushed students to participate in class, and I liked the pressure she put on participation.
Working with clients.

The readings. Expanding my understanding about 'what is possible' from learning about the work of the NRDC. Having an applied way of learning about law and regulation. Being a part of making regulatory change. Learning from the experience of Kit Kennedy. Playing the classroom games as a taste of the experience of law school. Working with a client and developing my professional style. Everything. This class is excellent.

The breadth of the projects to choose from, the expertise of the instructors, and the variability of the in-class experiences all add up to a very worthwhile course in and out of the classroom. Just the right amount of reading for the lecture component of the course, too. The games/exercises were also a great touch.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: More non-NRDC projects. NRDC folks may not be as appreciative or in need of graduate Yale student help as other organizations may be.
The class size was very small, which inhibited discussion, especially on field trips which weren't very well attended.

The degree to which clinic projects are outlined, explained, and contained early in the semester. I am still working on finishing this project up now because the project definition happened too late in the semester.

I think that the in-class experience for those taking the course for three credits could be taken a bit more seriously by the students. Some lectures were poorly attended and some students obviously didn't prepare beforehand. Maybe there's an incentive structure to change this.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: The in class lectures did not follow the projects at all. It wasn't until the last day during presentations where I learned what clinic projects others were doing. Would be great if we discussed our projects during the class portion. I think this would help our projects too.
The lectures and class work was at times distracting from the large client projects which demanded so much attention. nontheless, the additional work was valuable.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am here to learn mechanics of law and policy. This class taught me so very much about these mechanics in an applied way, which is how I learn best.

I have 6+ years working in natural resource policy at the local, state, and federal level.Much of the material was not new to me, but I understand and appreciate that it is new to many. All depends on what your background and experience level is prior to class.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Because of the clinic/client opportunity
Experience working with actual clients on a concrete project.
see above.
Interest in the client-sponsored projects and the in-class experience to a lesser extent.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: I expected the project to be more concrete with a more defined work product.
above and beyond.
For the in-class experience, mostly.For the client-sponsored project, absolutely.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: I had a great partner who had a different professional background from me, so we learned a lot together.

I worked with a joint degree student with PACE law. She had a very different set of skills and experience than my own. i learned an incredible amount from her. I found her to be responsible and rigorous in her work. the collaboration was excellent.

Advantages: great team, smooth process, efficient organization and good communication. In other words, our team performed well together without hiccups. The best group work experience thus far (personally) at Yale.Disadvantages: none, really. This was the best group work experience I've had in graduate school to date. It beat many professional group work experiences I've had, too.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Make sure you pick your project wisely and ensure you're passionate about the topic. Clearly communicate your workplan and scope of work with your sponsor.
Make sure there is a project that you really want to work with, because the clinic aspect takes up a lot of hours, so you want to make sure that you are very interested in the project.
Dive in! This is unequivocally an excellent class and a valuable experience.
do it!Pick your project carefully and even give some though to pre-selecting your team (to the extent that it's possible). You may thank yourself.
